rows.reference:
United Nations Children’s Fund, Handwashing Promotion Monitoring and Evaluation Module. New York: UNICEF; 2013.

Extract:
Critical (handwashing) events include:
- After toileting
- After contact with human or animal faeces:
    * After cleaning a child’s anus
    * After removing child’s faeces from the yard
    * After contact with animal dung
- Before preparing food
- Before serving food
- Before eating
- Before feeding a child/breastfeeding
- After coughing or sneezing
- After blowing nose
- Other:
    * After eating
    * After handling livestock
    * After cleaning or sweeping inside or outside the house

rows.title: When do we wash hands?

text.eng:
To help keep healthy it is very important to wash your hands with soap at the following times:
* Before and after cooking
* Before eating
* Before and after attending a sick person
* After using the toilet
* After changing a baby’s nappy

rows.title: Washing your hands with soap feels good

title.eng: Washing your hands with soap feels good

text.eng: When you wash your hands with soap, your hands will feel and smell clean and fresh.

rows.text: When you wash your hands with soap, your hands will feel and smell clean and fresh.

rows.title: Cleaning after changing nappies

text.eng: Baby poop looks and smells different from adult poop, but it can still make you sick. It's important to wash your hands after cleaning a baby's nappy.
